    • Enum Constant Detail

      • SOFT_RESET

        public static final ResetOption SOFT_RESET
        End processing of any current command or wait state and reset internal state variables.

      • HARD_RESET

        public static final ResetOption HARD_RESET
        This option will perform a check for any software or configuration updates which may have been sent to the PED and apply them. Updating the operating system, the MPI application and certain configuration files will cause the unit to either perform a full reboot or restart the application, in these cases the link will be disconnected by the PED after the response has been sent.

      • CLEAR_FILES

        public static final ResetOption CLEAR_FILES
        This option will remove all downloaded and temporary files. Use this option is recommended before attempting a software download and update.

      • CLEAR_FILES_AND_REINIT_MSD

        public static final ResetOption CLEAR_FILES_AND_REINIT_MSD
        This option will remove all downloaded and temporary files. In addition it will reinitialise the MSD, which will free up any previously used space back to the main file system. Note that existing contents of the MSD will be lost following this command. This operation can take up to 30 seconds to respond. This operation will fail if the MSD is currently exported.

        'P2' may optionally be set to a non-zero value to specify the MSD maximum size, in megabytes. Default size is recommended, leaving this parameter as '00'.

        'Data field' may optionally be filled with a string for the MSD volume name. Maximum length 11 characters. Space and special characters except '-', '_' and '.' are not allowed. Default name is recommended, leaving 'Data field' as Empty. The default name is as specified in the MPI- Production.cfg (See section #14.3.2.[MSD] Configuration)
